intro: Seraphyta multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered seraphyta, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are showy, with five petals, and are usually pink or white in color. Seraphyta multiflora produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals.
